org.jamesframework.core.search.cache

Class SingleEvaluatedMoveCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.core.search.cache.SingleEvaluatedMoveCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EvaluatedMoveCache

    public class SingleEvaluatedMoveCache
extends Object
implements EvaluatedMoveCache
    A single move cache only stores the last evaluation and validity that were offered to the cache. Any previously cached value is immediately discarded and replaced with the new value. In general, most neighbourhood searches select a single candidate move (random, best, ...) from the neighbourhood in every step and then merely decide whether or not to apply it to the current solution. Therefore, a single move cache can be used to appropriately cache the validity and evaluation of this candidate move, with minor memory overhead.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SingleEvaluatedMoveCache()
      Create an empty single evaluated move cache.

      • getCachedMoveEvaluation

        public final Double getCachedMoveEvaluation(Move<?> move)
        Retrieve a cached evaluation, if still available. If the evaluation of any other move has been cached at a later point in time, it will have overwritten the evaluation of this move.
        Specified by:
        getCachedMoveEvaluation in interface EvaluatedMoveCache
        Parameters:
        move - move applied to the current solution
        Returns:
        cached evaluation of the obtained neighbour, if available, null if not

      • cacheMoveRejection

        public final void cacheMoveRejection(Move<?> move,
                                     boolean isRejected)
        Cache rejection of the given move, discarding any previously cached value.

        Parameters:

        isRejected - indicates whether the obtained neighbour is rejected

      • getCachedMoveRejection

        public final Boolean getCachedMoveRejection(Move<?> move)
        Retrieve cached rejection, if still available. If rejection of any other move has been cached at a later point in time, the value for this move will have been overwritten.
        Specified by:
        getCachedMoveRejection in interface EvaluatedMoveCache
        Parameters:
        move - move applied to the current solution
        Returns:
        true if the obtained neighbour is known to be rejected, null if the requested value is not available in the cache
